name: Rishikesh
fun_fact: Fun fact: Rishikesh is completely meat and alcohol-free - the entire city respects its status as a sacred space, making it the world's largest vegetarian city and the 'Yoga Capital of the World'!

hero_dishes.name: Sattvic Thali
hero_dishes.description: Pure vegetarian meal without onion or garlic - rice, dal, vegetables, chapati, chutney
hero_dishes.origin_story: Ashram food designed to promote mental clarity and spiritual practice
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Parmath Niketan Ashram cafeteria, yoga ashrams throughout

hero_dishes.name: Aloo Tikki
hero_dishes.description: Crispy spiced potato patties served with chutneys
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Street vendors in Rishikesh Main Market

hero_dishes.name: Garhwali Dal
hero_dishes.description: Thick aromatic curry of roasted black gram with ginger and garlic
hero_dishes.origin_story: Traditional Himalayan cuisine from local Garhwal region

hero_dishes.name: Mandua Ki Roti
hero_dishes.description: Finger millet flatbread with nutty flavor - nutritious hill region staple
hero_dishes.origin_story: Traditional Himalayan bread from ancient grains

signature_drinks.name: Masala Chai
signature_drinks.description: Spiced tea with cardamom, ginger, and milk
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: From chai wallahs on every corner, especially at sunrise on the ghats

signature_drinks.name: Ayurvedic Herbal Tea
signature_drinks.description: Healing teas made with tulsi, ashwagandha, and other herbs
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: At yoga centers and Ayurvedic cafes

food_culture_notes: No meat or alcohol sold anywhere in the city
Swarg Ashram on east bank of Ganges has multiple vegetarian eateries
Chotiwala is famous local spot for thalis
Ayurpak specializes in Ayurvedic organic cooking
